CatDescriptText: Mrs. Agnes Norvell Mack, housewife, Washington, Pa. and Mr. Milton Powell, insurance agent, McDonald, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, August 26, 1961, pg. 1  with question: "Do you think there will be war over Berlin?"  Mrs. Mack's answer reads: "I think there's a great possibility that there will be war.  Though it probably will be minor to begin with, I only hope and pray that it doesn't turn into anything major."  Mr. Powell's answer reads: "I think there's a possibility but I don't believe, just because there is a crisis at the present time, that there is a demand for war.  I think it can be solved without it."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Agnes Norvell Mack wearing light colored button down collared shirt with liquor bottle pattern, standing in front of ribbed metal wall; Portrait of Milton Powell wearing suit jacket, ribbon pin, and straw hat, buildings in background
